item.title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet计划通过发行美元债券筹集200亿美元
item.description: Alphabet公司计划通过发行美元债券筹集200亿美元资金，超出此前150亿美元的预期规模。【原文：Alphabet Inc. is set to raise $20 billion from its US dollar bond offering, exceeding earlier expectations for a $15 billion deal.】

item.title: 摩根大通称定制市政债券账户规模增至1.3万亿美元
item.description: 定制化投资需求正推动市政债券个性化投资组合的激增。【原文：Demand for tailor-made investments is fueling a surge in personalized portfolios of municipal bonds.】

item.title: 甲骨文股价飙升，科技巨头支出缓解软件行业忧虑
item.description: 甲骨文公司股价周一延续反弹势头，因美国科技巨头加大资本支出力度，缓解了市场对人工智能发展对该公司构成威胁的担忧。【原文：Oracle Corp. shares extended their rebound on Monday, as ramped up capex spending by US technology giants helped soothe nerves over the threat posed to the company by developments in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 拉加德敦促政界人士协助欧洲央行增强欧洲实力
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜·拉加德表示，该行正努力确保通胀率保持在可控范围内，作为巩固欧洲经济的一部分，并敦促立法者落实一系列必要的改革措施。【原文：The European Central Bank is striving to ensure inflation remains under control as part of efforts to fortify the continent’s economy, President Christine Lagarde said, urging lawmakers to follow through on a list of necessary reforms.】

item.title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet发行的美元债券认购需求突破1000亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Alphabet公司发行的债券已获得超过1000亿美元的认购订单，而此次债券发行规模预计约为150亿美元。【原文：Alphabet Inc. has attracted more than $100 billion of orders for a bond sale that’s expected to be about $15 billion, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: Jump Trading准备收购Kalshi和Polymarket的股权
item.description: 知情人士透露，Jump Trading将通过为预测市场平台提供流动性，换取在Kalshi Inc.和Polymarket中持有少量股权。【原文：Jump Trading is set to gain small stakes in Kalshi Inc. and Polymarket in exchange for providing liquidity on the prediction-market platforms, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 纽约护士达成初步协议 结束持续数周的罢工
item.description: 数千名纽约市护士与当地医院达成初步劳资协议，这场持续数周的罢工有望告一段落。【原文：Thousands of New York City nurses reached a tentative labor agreement with local hospitals, putting an end in sight to a strike that’s stretched on for weeks.】

item.title: 保险公司正在吞噬世界
item.description: 包括住房贷款市场。【原文：Including the market for home loans.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔表示，央行可忽略低于目标的通胀水平
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员约阿希姆·纳格尔表示，欧洲央行可以容忍通胀率暂时低于目标水平，但必须随时准备在必要时采取行动。【原文：The European Central Bank can look though a bout of below-target inflation but must remain ready to act in either direction if needed, Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said.】

item.title: 美联储调查显示美国消费者通胀预期与就业预期双双改善
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行的调查显示，1月份美国消费者对通胀和就业市场的预期略有改善。【原文：US consumer expectations for inflation and the job market improved slightly in January, according to a Federal Reserve Bank of New York survey.】

item.title: 洪都拉斯准备削减开支，国际货币基金组织代表团即将到访
item.description: 洪都拉斯计划大幅削减今年预算，并暂停央行向政府拨款，国际货币基金组织官员将于本月访问该国。【原文：Honduras plans to slash this year’s budget and halt central bank transfers to the government, as International Monetary Fund officials prepare to visit this month.】

item.title: 微软遭二次评级下调，梅利厄斯警告人工智能风险
item.description: 微软公司股价在不到一周内第二次遭下调评级，因华尔街对软件股可能面临人工智能冲击的担忧日益加剧。【原文：Microsoft Corp. shares were downgraded for the second time in less than a week as Wall Street grows increasingly wary about the potential disruption software stocks face from artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 马斯克将重心转向月球，火星任务仍需数年才能实现
item.description: 当大多数美国人周日晚间沉醉于观看本年度超级碗赛事时，埃隆·马斯克却在X平台宣布，SpaceX公司将优先建设月球基地，之后再派遣人类登陆火星。【原文：While most Americans were transfixed by this year’s Super Bowl proceedings on Sunday night, Elon Musk took to X to proclaim that SpaceX would focus on building out a base on the moon before sending humans to Mars.】

item.title: WPP整合创意部门后将裁员
item.description: 知情人士透露，英国广告集团WPP Plc计划将旗下三家创意机构整合为一体，预计将导致裁员，因为这些业务将共享更多后端资源。【原文：British advertising group WPP Plc’s plan to bring its three creative agencies under one roof is expected to result in job cuts as the businesses will share more back-end resources, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 凯德瑞股价暴跌，因首席财务官离职及披露会计审查
item.description: 国际商业机器公司分拆出来的基德瑞尔控股公司周一早盘股价暴跌，此前该公司宣布关键管理层离职并启动会计实务审查。【原文：Shares of Kyndryl Holdings Inc., an International Business Machines Corp. spinoff, plunged Monday morning after the company announced key leadership exits and a review of its accounting practices.】

item.title: 社交网络因成瘾指控面临烟草业式危机
item.description: 十多年来，Facebook、谷歌等科技巨头一直否认有关他们刻意设计产品让儿童沉迷社交媒体的指控。【原文：Facebook, Google and other tech giants for more than a decade have rejected allegations that they build products deliberately to get kids addicted to social media.】

item.title: 高盛策略师预计美国IPO规模将从2025年水平大幅攀升
item.description: 高盛集团策略师表示，美国首次公开募股今年有望反弹，其依据包括稳健的经济环境、董事会信心的提升以及支持性的货币政策等利好因素。【原文：US initial public offerings are poised to rebound this year, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists said, citing tailwinds including a solid economic backdrop, rising boardroom confidence and supportive monetary policy.】

item.title: 美国海事委员会在印度洋对一艘与委内瑞拉有关联的油轮实施制裁
item.description: 五角大楼称，美军在加勒比海至印度洋展开一场猫鼠游戏般的追逐后登上一艘油轮。随着华盛顿扩大地理范围，持续打击用于出口受制裁原油的全球影子船队。【原文：US forces boarded an oil tanker after a cat-and-mouse chase from the Caribbean to the Indian Ocean, the Pentagon said, as Washington expands its geographic scope in an ongoing crackdown on a global shadow fleet used to export sanctioned crude.】

item.title: 欧洲央行委员卡齐米尔表示，只有在经济前景发生重大变化时才会调整利率
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员彼得·卡齐米尔表示，只有当欧洲央行对经济前景的判断发生重大变化时，才应调整利率。【原文：The European Central Bank should only alter interest rates if its outlook for the economy shifts significantly, according to Governing Council member Peter Kazimir.】

item.title: Workday联合创始人重返公司担任首席执行官，此时公司股价正大幅下跌
item.description: Workday公司宣布联合创始人阿尼尔·布什里将回归执掌这家软件公司，接替首席执行官卡尔·埃申巴赫。此前该公司股价在过去一年里大幅下跌。【原文：Workday Inc. announced co-founder Aneel Bhusri is returning to head the software company, replacing chief executive officer Carl Eschenbach after the company’s shares have plummeted over the past year.】

item.title: 美国股市小幅走低，交易员静候关键经济数据
item.description: 周一美国股市方向不明，科技股相关担忧持续发酵，投资者正为本周密集的经济数据发布做准备。【原文：US stocks were struggling for direction on Monday as worries around tech-heavy stocks lingered and investors geared up for a busy week of economic data.】

item.title: 刚果将对铜、钴矿商实施本地所有权规则
item.description: 刚果民主共和国将执行一项长期搁置的规定，要求矿山实行本地员工持股。此举可能重新平衡全球部分最大铜、钴生产商的股权结构。【原文：Democratic Republic of Congo will enforce a long-dormant rule requiring local employee ownership for mines in a move that may rebalance shareholdings in some of the world’s biggest copper and cobalt producers.】

item.title: 哈塞特预计就业数据将趋于疲软，因人口增长放缓
item.description: 美国国家经济委员会主任凯文·哈塞特表示，随着人口增长放缓，未来数月美国就业数据预计将出现下滑。【原文：National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said lower US jobs numbers can be expected in the months ahead as population growth slows.】

item.title: 通用大西洋前全球科技主席莱维推出专注初创企业的基金
item.description: 安东·莱维，前通用大西洋联合总裁兼全球技术投资主席，正着手创立自己的投资公司——Layer Global。【原文：Anton Levy, the former co-president and chairman of global technology investments at General Atlantic, is starting his own investment firm, Layer Global.】

item.title: 巴西在经历数十年来最繁忙的一年后，正积极开拓全球债务市场
item.description: 巴西在经历二十多年来最繁忙的债券发行年后，正重返国际债务市场。【原文：Brazil is returning to international debt markets following its busiest issuance year in more than two decades.】

item.title: 北欧电力价格飙升至2022年能源危机以来的最高水平
item.description: 北欧电力价格飙升至2022年末能源危机高峰以来的最高水平，严寒天气推高需求，而低风速则导致供应紧张。【原文：Nordic power prices surged to their highest level since the height of the energy crisis in late 2022 as a severe cold snap boosts demand and low wind levels squeeze supplies.】

item.title: 意大利检方对Delivery Hero旗下子公司实施司法监管
item.description: 意大利检察官已将Delivery Hero SE旗下的意大利食品配送业务置于司法监管之下，作为针对涉嫌劳动剥削的刑事调查的一部分。【原文：Italian prosecutors have placed Delivery Hero SE’s Italian food-delivery unit under judicial control as part of a criminal investigation into alleged labor exploitation.】

item.title: 雷森公司聘请顾问，因债务担忧导致债券暴跌
item.description: 惠誉评级将Raízen SA的信用评级从投资级大幅下调至垃圾级，因控股方Cosan SA与壳牌公司未能就如何拯救这家合资企业达成协议，导致其财务困境进一步恶化。【原文：Raízen SA’s credit scored was slashed deep into junk from investment grade by Fitch Ratings as controllers Cosan SA and Shell Plc fail to come to an agreement on how to rescue the joint-venture, worsening its financial woes.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织总裁淡化美元的"短期波动"
item.description: 国际货币基金组织负责人淡化了过去一年美元的贬值，称这种货币很可能保持其主导地位。【原文：The head of the International Monetary Fund downplayed the dollar’s decline over the past year, saying the US currency will probably retain its preeminent position.】

item.title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet计划发行科技行业自互联网泡沫时代以来首只百年期债券
item.description: 字母表公司计划发行一种极为罕见的百年期债券，作为其大规模债务发行计划的一部分。这是自1990年代末以来，科技公司首次发行如此长期限的债务。【原文：Alphabet Inc. plans to sell a very rare 100-year bond as part of its mega debt issue, in the first sale of such long-dated debt by a technology firm since the late 1990s.】
